questions.question_text: After performing a security assessment for a firm, the client was found to have been billed for the time the client's test environment was unavailable. The client claims to have been billed unfairly. Which of the following documents would MOST likely be able to provide guidance in such a situation?

discussion.content:
I agree with D1960.

https://alistapart.com/article/agreements-equal-expectations/

"A SOW, on the other hand, typically addresses such things as:
Billing Rates—What you’re charging for each practitioner in your company."

Maybe A. SOW?
Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA)? - seems unlikely:
> A blanket order, blanket purchase agreement or call-off order[1] is a purchase order which a customer places with its supplier to allow multiple delivery dates over a period of time, often negotiated to take advantage of predetermined pricing. It is normally used when there is a recurring need for expendable goods. Blanket orders are often used when a customer buys large quantities and has obtained special discounts. Based on the blanket order, sales orders ('blanket releases' or 'release orders') and invoice items can be created as needed until the contract is fulfilled, the end of the order period is reached or a pre-determined maximum order value is reached.
Reference:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blanket_order

comments.content: BPA, likely means Business Partnership Agreement in this context. I agree that SOW is best here...IMO

SOW would be the best document to have it in, for given assessment:
"The MSA is usually the governing document for the entire relationship, while the SOW usually deals with the specifics of a single project or scope of work."
